definition.name: quantum-6j-symbol
definition.definition: The quantum 6j symbol {j1 j2 j3; j4 j5 j6}_q for U_q(su(2)), the q-analog of the Racah-Wigner 6j symbol. For q a root of unity (q = exp(2pi i/r)), these are finite and define the Turaev-Viro state sum invariant of 3-manifolds. For q=1, gives the standard 6j symbol whose large-j asymptotics yield the Ponzano-Regge 3D gravity action.
